玦字的基本解释

玦
jué
半环形有缺口的佩玉，古代常用以赠人表示决绝：绝人以玦。
戴于右拇指助拉弓弦之器。俗称“扳指”。

玦字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jué］
［《廣韻》古穴切，入屑，見。］
(1)古时佩带的玉器。环形，有缺口。常用作表示决断、决绝的象征物。
(2)射箭时钩弦之具。

玦字的康熙字典解释

【午集上】【玉字部】　玦； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页728第12
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】古穴切【正韻】居穴切，?音決。【說文】玉佩也。【廣韻】佩如環而有缺，逐臣待命於境，賜環則返，賜玦則絕。義取訣。【史記·項羽紀】范增數以手循玦示項羽。【前漢·五行志】佩之金。【註】師古曰：半環曰玦。【白虎通】君子能決斷則佩玦。玦，環之不周也。　又射者著於右手大指以鉤弦者亦謂之玦。【禮·內則】右佩玦。【詩·衞風·童子佩韘傳】韘，玦也。【疏】玦，挾矢時所以持弦飾也。【釋文】玦，本又作決。【小雅】決拾旣佽。　又【詩話】紫玉玦茶也，烏玉玦墨也。【蘇軾·謝惠茶詩】空煩赤泥印，遠致紫玉玦。【孫莘老寄墨詩】近者唐夫子，遠致烏玉玦。　【集韻】或作璚。

玦字的起名意思

半环形有缺口的佩玉。

Jue
Basic explanation of words
Jue
jué
A jade with a gap in the semi-circle was often used as a gift to express decisiveness in ancient times.
A tool worn on the right thumb to help draw the bowstring. Commonly known as "pull finger".
Jue
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jué］
["Guangyun" ancient acupoint cutting, into the scraps, see. ]
(1) Jadeware worn in ancient times. Ring-shaped, with gaps. It is often used as a symbol of determination and determination.
(2) Tools for hooking when archery.
Jue
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Won Collection 1] [Jade Character Department] 　玦; Kangxi Strokes: 9; Page Number: Page 728 No. 12
[Tang Yun] [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Ancient acupoint cutting [Zhengyun] Acupuncture cutting, sound determination. [Said the text] Yu Pei also. [Guang Yun] Pei is like a ring but lacks, and the ministers are on standby. The ring is given to return, and the gift to Jue is absolutely nothing. Righteousness. 【Historical Records·Xiang Yuji】Fan Zengshu shows Xiang Yu by hand. 【Former Han·Five Elements】Peace of Gold. [Note] Shigu said: Half-ring said Jue. [Baihutong] If a gentleman can decide, Peijue. Jue, the ring is not perfect.　The person who shoots again is also called the person who hooks the string with the big finger of the right hand. [Li · Nei Ze] You Peijue. 【Poetry·Weifeng·Biography of Boy Peiyun】Yun, Ji Ye. 【Sparse】Yue, when holding the arrow, I hold the string. [Explanation] Jue, Ben made a decision again. [Xiaoya] Decided to pick up 旣佽.　[Poetry] Zi Yujue tea, Wu Yujue ink. 【Su Shi·Xie Hui Tea Poems】Empty and red mud prints are as far away as purple jade jue. [Sun Xin Lao Sending Ink Poems] Master Tang, who is near, is as far away as Wu Yujue.　【Jiyun】Or as a brush.
Jue
